abstract: Boom in New York's live stand-up comedy shows is fueled by comics invited to perform at nontraditional spaces including pizza parlors and eateries; comedians, paid with food and drink, benefit from communal feeling with audience and business owners enhance their connection with neighborhood.
lead_paragraph: As stand-up spreads out of traditional comedy clubs in New York, new spaces include a biscuit shop, a pizzeria and Central Park.

headline.main: Stand-Up Comedy Beyond the Brick Wall
headline.print_headline: Stand-Up Comedy Beyond the Brick Wall

snippet: As stand-up spreads out of traditional comedy clubs in New York, new spaces include a biscuit shop, a pizzeria and Central Park.
